title: How to Play Minecraft Without an Internet Connection

steps.title: Download Minecraft and log in before going offline.
steps.content: Download Minecraft and log in before going offline. Single-player mode is automatically offline and can be played anywhere. [1] X Research source However, you have to have an internet connection to initially download the game and log in. [2] X Research source Once the game has been downloaded, click the “Login” button and enter your Microsoft username and password. Create a Microsoft account if you don’t already have one. You cannot play Multiplayer mode on Minecraft without being connected to the internet. If you have a Mac or Linux computer, simply open the Minecraft launcher after logging in to play any previously downloaded version offline.

steps.title: Enable offline play if you have a Windows computer.
steps.content: Enable offline play if you have a Windows computer. While you’re connected to the internet, check to make sure your PC has the latest updates by going to “Start” > “Settings” > “Update & security” > “Windows Update.” Go to the Microsoft Store. Select your profile icon, then go to “App settings” > “Offline permissions,” and make sure the toggle is set to “On.” [3] X Research source Launch your Minecraft game and log in with your Microsoft account. After that, you can go offline and launch Minecraft whenever you want without signing in each time. Once you go offline, you won’t be able to make these changes to your computer.

steps.title: Buy and download Minecraft while you’re still online.
steps.content: Buy and download Minecraft while you’re still online. Purchase Minecraft on the Xbox store . Follow the instructions to download it onto your console. [4] X Research source When you first set up your Xbox, it will ask you to log into Microsoft or create a new account, so there’s no need to do that before you go offline. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Make sure your console is set as your home Xbox.
steps.content: Make sure your console is set as your home Xbox. Press the Xbox button on your controller. In the sidebar, go to “Profile & system” > “Settings” > “General” > “Personalization,” and choose “My home Xbox.” Select “Make this my home Xbox.” This will allow you to play your games and apps offline on your current console. [6] X Research source You can switch your home Xbox up to 5 times in 1 year. If you reach the limit for the year, a notification will tell you the next available date you can change it.

steps.title: Set your Xbox to offline mode.
steps.content: Set your Xbox to offline mode. Press the Xbox button on your controller, then go to “Settings” > “General” > “Network Settings.” Choose “Go offline.” This not only allows you to play Minecraft online, but you can also still save game clips and earn achievements. [7] X Research source Once you’re done, you can launch the game and play single-player as normal. When you want to go back online, navigate to this same screen and press “Go online.”

steps.title: Buy and download Minecraft from the PlayStation Store.
steps.content: Buy and download Minecraft from the PlayStation Store. Sign in to the PlayStation Network and buy Minecraft from the PlayStation Store. Follow the instructions to download the game to your console. [8] X Research source To play this game on your PS5, you may have to update it to the latest version. On PS5, go to “Settings” > “System” > “System Software” > “System Software Update and Settings.” Select “Update System Software” if “Update Available appears onscreen. [9] X Research source To [[ create a PlayStation Network account , create a new user on your console and select “Create an account.”

steps.title: If you have a PS4, activate it as your primary console.
steps.content: If you have a PS4, activate it as your primary console. This will allow you to play and manage Minecraft and other purchased games. Go to “Settings” > “Account Management” > “Activate as Your Primary PlayStation 4.” Select “Activate.” If you have another console, go to the same page and click “Deactivate.” [10] X Research source If this is your first PlayStation console, it will automatically be activated as your primary device. If your PS4 still doesn’t launch the game, try disconnecting it from the internet entirely. Go to “Settings” > “Network” and clear the checkbox next to “Connect to the Internet.” [11] X Research source

steps.title: If you have a PS5, activate Console Sharing and Offline Play.
steps.content: If you have a PS5, activate Console Sharing and Offline Play. This will allow you and anyone who uses your console to play games and media even when you’re offline. On the home page, go to “Settings” > “Users and Accounts” > “Other” > “Console Sharing and Offline Play.” Select “Enable.” [12] X Research source If you have another PS5 enabled, go to the same screen on the console you don’t want to play offline on and select “Disable.” This is automatically enabled on the PS5 console you used to sign into the PlayStation Network for the first time.

steps.title: Sign out of the PlayStation Network.
steps.content: Sign out of the PlayStation Network. To sign out on the PS4, go to “Settings” > “Account Management,” then select “Sign Out.” On PS5, go to “Settings” > “Users and Accounts” and select “Other” > “Sign Out.” This will disconnect your PlayStation from online features. [13] X Research source You can also sign out of all your PlayStation devices by signing into Sony Account Management . In the left sidebar, click “Security,” then select “Sign Out on All Devices.” Open Minecraft to make sure it works offline. If it doesn’t, sign back into the Network and make sure you’ve activated your PS4 as your primary console or PS5 Offline Play.

steps.title: Navigate to and open the “Minecraft Server” folder on your computer.
steps.content: Navigate to and open the “Minecraft Server” folder on your computer. When you created your server, you made a folder on your desktop or somewhere in your computer called “Minecraft Server” to hold the files for it. [14] X Research source Open this folder. If you can’t find the folder and you have a Windows computer, click on the search bar in your taskbar and type in “Minecraft Server.” [15] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source In Mac, go to the Finder, then “Go” > “Go to Folder.” Type in “Minecraft Server” and double-click on the folder when it appears. [16] X Research source This method only works if you host your own Minecraft server , or have access to the files for a friend’s Minecraft server.

steps.title: Double-click the “server.properties” file to open it.
steps.content: Double-click the “server.properties” file to open it. If the file doesn’t open as an editable text file, right-click it, go to “Open with” > “More apps,” and select “Notepad” or whatever text editor is installed on your device. [17] X Research source To avoid opening this file using the “Open with” option each time, click the checkbox in the popup that says “Always use this app to open .properties files.”

steps.title: Locate “online-mode=true” in the list and change “true” to “false.”
steps.content: Locate “online-mode=true” in the list and change “true” to “false.” Delete “true” in the line and write “false” instead. The line will now read as “online-mode=false,” which means that online mode is disabled on your server. [18] X Research source This also means that the server doesn’t check to see if players connecting to it have valid accounts. [19] X Research source Set this to “false” only if your server is not going to be connected to the internet, or hackers with fake Minecraft accounts may be able to connect to it. Select the option to save changes, then exit the text editor. If you’re working in Notepad, click “File” in the upper left corner of the window, then press “Save.”

steps.title: Open the launcher, select “Play Offline,” then select your Minecraft server.
steps.content: Open the launcher, select “Play Offline,” then select your Minecraft server. Make sure you’re signed into Microsoft on Minecraft before you go offline. If you’re not, press “Login” on the launcher and enter your account information. Click on “Play Offline” on the title screen, then select your private server to begin playing.

steps.title: Download the Realms world you want to play on before going offline.
steps.content: Download the Realms world you want to play on before going offline. Launch Minecraft and click “Play” or “Minecraft Realms.” Select the Realm slot with the world you want to download, then choose “Edit World.” Choose “Download World” to download the most recent version of your world, or select “Backups” to choose and download any of your world’s past backup save files. [20] X Research source You won’t be able to play with your friends while you’re offline, but you can continue to make progress on the game alone. If you’re playing on a PC, you have to download Minecraft and log in with your Microsoft account before you go offline. After that, all you have to do is select the downloaded Realm world in your local worlds list to begin playing.
